definition: to own exclusively/unique to/specific/there is only
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
not alone but in pairs (idiom, usually derog.); not a unique occurrence/it's not the only case

sentences.english: Industry is not alone in its abuse of animals in product testing.
sentences.chinese: 在测试产品时凌虐动物这一方面，工业是无独有偶的。

sentences.english: Every general-purpose computer has its own unique instruction repertoire.
sentences.chinese: 每台通用计算机都有其独有的指令系统。

sentences.english: Unique seascape toilet attaching to the main bedroom elucidates individual life space.
sentences.chinese: 独有全海景主卧洗手间，张扬个性生活空间。

sentences.english: The two-floor stage design provides a better stage view and more possiblity for performers.
sentences.chinese: 独有的双层舞台设计，更让演出拥有多样可能性。

sentences.english: Monolog: Sometimes we are on a collision course and we just don't know it.
sentences.chinese: 事情的发展总是无独有偶，我们就是不知道。

sentences.english: Loyalty is a characteristic only planeswalkers have.
sentences.chinese: 忠诚度是旅法师独有的特征。

sentences.english: After the lining which processes once again could be out of the ordinary, unique.
sentences.chinese: 颠末再度处置地面料将会是不同凡响，无独有偶地。

sentences.english: God loves you and wants an exclusive relationship with you.
sentences.chinese: 神爱你也希望和你建立起独有的情谊。

sentences.english: However, being portraits of former Headmasters has gained them a unique quality.
sentences.chinese: 不过，作为已故校长的肖像，他们有一个独有的特点。

sentences.english: Birth and development of the criminal law aid system of our country have its unique orbit.
sentences.chinese: 我国刑事法律援助制度的诞生与发展有其独有的轨迹。

sentences.english: Taking personal breaks shouldn’t be an exclusive privilege for managers.
sentences.chinese: 利用个人休息时间不应是经理们独有的特权。

sentences.english: Exclusive to Walex and New Prof Fine Product Enterprise. Ltd.
sentences.chinese: 气味是Walex及新刚优品企业所独有。

sentences.english: Especially the side of the barbeque pork with honey, contains aroma of charcoals , it's just so unique!
sentences.chinese: 尤其是带点焦的边位，更是有一股炭烤独有的香味。

sentences.english: But are these values unique to America?
sentences.chinese: 但这些价值观是美国独有的吗？

sentences.english: This is the unique charm of Wang.
sentences.chinese: 这就是王朔独有的气势。

sentences.english: Because of her findings, the movent to end the powerful monopolies was greatly sengthened.
sentences.chinese: 由于她的发现，大大加强告终束独有垄断运动的权势。

definition: lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
unique and unmatched (idiom); unrivalled/nothing compares with it
to stand out from the masses (idiom)
having a unique or distinctive style
to assign/to entrust (a task)/to give/to bestow
